name: A Crazy Plan
effect: If you haven’t played a card in a talent stack during this stage, raise all talents needed for this challenge by the amount of Destiny Points this challenge is worth. You cannot play any cards into talent stacks for the remainder of this stage.

name: A Thing
effect: If this skill is attached to your Main Character, you may discard this skill whenever your opponent tries to unattach an item from a Hero or Companion. The item stays attached and cannot be swapped for the remainder of the turn.

name: All's Well That Ends Well
effect: Discard the top card of your Resource Deck. If it’s an episode card, the Conflict Step is skipped for this turn. Send to the Crypt after use.

name: Ambushed
effect: If you have a character at the location of this challenge, this challenge immediately ends in the Challenge/Choose Stage. You immediately start a fight with a character that participated in this challenge. After this fight, your opponent must immediately face this challenge again if possible.

name: Amy Madison
effect: Rat. Once per turn, you may fatigue Amy Madison to give another character with the Spellcraft Trait +1 to all his talents for the remainder of the turn.

name: And Hell Follows Him
effect: Assign to the Vampire Mansion. This challenge may only be faced at night.

name: Angel
effect: Vampire. If you have no other characters at Angel’s location, Angel gains +1 to all his talents and an additional +1 Butt-Kicking.

name: Angel
effect: Vampire. Angel has the card powers of his previous 2 levels.

name: Angel
effect: Vampire. Angel may make 1 additional move during the Movement Step of a day turn.

name: Angel
effect: Vampire. During the Movement Step Angel may make 1 additional move from a school or indoor location to an adjacent indoor or school location when it is day.

name: Angel / Spike
effect: Angel may move 2 additional times during the day.

name: Anyanka
effect: Demon, Spellcraft. If Anyanka is in a fight with Symbol of Anyanka attached and your opponent changes the resolving talent, you choose the resolving talent instead. You cannot choose the previous resolving talent.

name: Anyanka
effect: Demon. Spellcraft. While Anyanka has Symbol of Anyanka attached, whenever your opponent searches his Resource Deck for a card, you perform the search for him.

name: Anyanka
effect: Demon. Spellcraft. Once per Resource Step, search your Resource Deck for Symbol of Anyanka and attach it.

name: April Fools Dress Ship
effect: Cordelia needs 2 less Destiny Points to ascend while here.

name: Ascension of Olivikan
effect: Assign to Fountain Quad. Only Mayor Richard Wilkens III and level 2 and above Villians may face this challenge. This challenge is worth 1 extra Destiny Point for each Hero and Villian your opponent has in play.

name: Balthazar
effect: Demon. Balthazar cannot move. At the beginning of a turn, choose a talent. All minions at Balthazar’s location gain +1 to that talent for the remainder of the turn.

name: Balthazar's Amulet
effect: Once during the Fight-Challenge/Battle stage, you may discard 2 cards from your hand to have this character gain +2 to any talent until the fight or challenge ends. If you lose the fight or challenge, send this item to the Crypt during the Fight-Challenge/Discard stage.

name: Band Candy Warehouse
effect: Except for Ethan Rayne and Main Characters, any Heroes here are Companions instead, and any Villians here are Minions instead.

name: Beauty and the Beast
effect: Assign to Garden Shed. The first winner of a fight each turn at this location gains 1 extra Destiny Point.

name: Been There, Killed That
effect: Discard a card. If your character just won this fight, your character does not fatigue and may immediately start a fight with another character at this location after this fight ends. Send to the Crypt after use.

name: Big Bang
effect: Discard the top card of your Resource Deck. If it’s an action card that can boost Weirdness by 2, discard all items attached to characters in play.

name: Birthday Tradition
effect: When this event is played, the player that played this event may search her Resource Deck for any item, show it to her opponent, and place it into her hand.

name: Bizarro Blood Bottling Plant
effect: Refreshed Vampires here gain +1 Butt-Kicking. Villian Vampires gain an additional +1 Butt-Kicking while refreshed here.

name: Bizarro Bronze
effect: When a Vampire at this location Stunt-Doubles for another character, the Vampire does not fatigue. Each player may do this once per turn.

name: Bizarro Buffy
effect: Human. If Buffy wins a fight, your opponent must discard down to X cards during the fight/Discard Stage, where X = 5 – the amount of Destiny Points earned from the fight.

name: Bizarro Streets of Sunnydale
effect: Characters at this location are considered to be in Sunnydale Park, for the purposes of controlling Sunnydale Park.

name: Bizarro Sun Cinema
effect: If a player’s Main Character is at this location, that player may draw up to a 7 card hand during the Draw Step.

name: Bizarro Sunnydale High School
effect: Main Characters may attach an additional skill per turn while here.

name: Bizarro Sunnydale School Library
effect: When a Hero at this location Stunt-Doubles for another character, the Hero does not fatigue. Each player may do this once per turn.

name: Black Hat
effect: Choose one of your characters in play. That character becomes a Villain for the remainder of the turn.

name: Blood and Crumpets
effect: If one of your Villian Vampires is at the same location as one of your Human Minions, send the Minion to the Crypt and gain 1 Destiny Point. Limit 1 per deck.

name: Boiler Room
effect: During the Resource Step, if there are no characters, challenges or other cards here, the owner of this location may swap this location with any other legally playable location in her Crypt.

name: Book Cramming
effect: Discard the top card of your Resource Deck. If it’s a skill, you may attach that skill to 1 of your characters and he does not fatigue. This character can attach another skill this turn.

name: Book Learning
effect: The resolving talent for this fight is now Smarts.

name: Books of Ascension
effect: Assign to a character with the Demonology Trait, Mayor Richard Wilkins III, or Faith. Character needs 2 less Destiny Points to ascend. Limit 1 per deck.

name: Bored Now
effect: Vamp Willow or Dark Willow only. Vamp Willow or Dark Willow starts a fight. If a Companion or Minion is defeated in this fight, that character is sent to the Crypt instead of the Discard Pile. Send to the Crypt after use.

name: Box of Gavrok
effect: Assign to a character with the Occult Trait or Mayor Richard Wilkins III. This character needs 2 less Destiny Points to ascend. Limit 1 per deck.

name: Bring Me My Amulet
effect: Characters at this location may swap an item to or from a character at an adjacent location. The characters facing this challenge must have at least 4 items attached to defeat this challenge.

name: Broken Wishes
effect: Fatigue one of your supporting Heroes in play. Your opponent must choose 1 item attached to 1 of his characters at the same location. The item is discarded, and all players discard their hand and draw 5 cards.

name: Buffy "First Patrol"
effect: Once per turn, Buffy may start a fight during the Movement Step, if there are no card effects keeping her from fighting.

name: Buffy / Riley
effect: Once per turn, Buffy may start a fight during the Movement Step, if there are no card effects keeping her from fighting.

name: Buffy Summers
effect: Human. Each turn, the first fight Buffy starts during the Conflict Step does not fatigue her during resolution.

name: Buffy Summers
effect: Human. If Buffy wins a fight she started against a Villian or Hero, you gain 1 extra Destiny Point. Buffy does not fatigue during the Fight/Resolve stage of the first fight she started this turn.

name: Buffy Summers
effect: Human. At the beginning of the Fight/Resolve Stage, Buffy gains +1 to the current resolving talent until the end of the fight.

name: Buffy Summers
effect: Human. Buffy may have 1 extra item. When Buffy is in a fight, draw a card at the end of the Fight/Battle Stage.

name: Buffy Summers "First Patrol"
effect: Human. Each turn, the first fight Buffy starts during the Conflict Step does not fatigue her during resolution.

name: Buffy Summers "First Patrol"
effect: Human. At the beginning of the Fight/Resolve Stage, Buffy gains +1 to the current resolving talent until the end of the fight.

name: Calling in the Heavy Artillery
effect: Search your Resource Deck for any item and attach it to 1 of your characters in play. That character cannot face a challenge this turn. The item is sent to the Crypt at the end of the turn, even if it is in the discard pile. Send to Crypt after use.

name: Candy Bars
effect: Assign to your opponent’s supporting character that is a Hero or Villian that can still attach an item. The character is now a Companion or Minion, respectively. This item cannot be swapped.

name: Caught in the Crossfire
effect: For the remainder of the game, whenever a player wins a fight, that player may choose to have a Companion or a Minion at the same location be discarded instead of the losing character.

name: Caught Off Guard
effect: Send to the Crypt an item attached to your character in this fight. Your opponent’s character gets a –2 to the current resolving talent for the remainder of the fight.

name: Chains
effect: Assign to one of your opponent’s characters. This item may not be swapped. This character’s Butt-Kicking is now 0 and cannot be raised above 0 or lowest below 0. A player may fatigue a different character at this character’s location to discard chains.

name: Channeled Aggresion
effect: You may discard this skill to have this character use her Butt-Kicking to meet a Charm or Smarts talent requirement on an action card.

name: Chaperone
effect: While this character is refreshed, your opponent may only start fights with characters at this location that have Chaperone attached. If your opponent starts a fight with this character, this character becomes fatigued at the beginning of the fight/discard stage.

name: Charming
effect: During the Resource Step, fatigue this character to fatigue another character at this location with a lower Charm.

name: City Hall
effect: Mayor Richard Wilkens III gains +1 to all his talents while at this location. When a character starts a fight with Mayor Richard Wilkens III, the attacker must discard 2 cards.

name: Clarion Call
effect: Discard the top card of your Resource Deck. If the card you discarded was a level 1 character that can be legally placed into play, you may place that character into play at any location.

name: Class Protector
effect: This character can Stunt-Double for your Companion at a different location. Place this character at that Companion’s location.

name: Cluck-Cluck
effect: Fatigue 1 of your Heroes or Villians in play. All of your opponents discard the top 3 cards of their Resource Deck.

name: Come to the Dark Side
effect: When this event is played, the player of this event chooses a supporting Hero or Companion. That Hero or Companion is now a Villian until that character leaves play.

name: Commencement Ceremonies
effect: Assign to the Fountain Quad. Only Buffy Summers and level 2 and above Heroes may face this challenge. This challenge is worth 1 extra Destiny Point for each Hero and Villian your opponent has in play.

name: Compound Bow
effect: This character may start a fight with a character at an adjacent location. Compound Bow counts as 2 items.

name: Cordelia
effect: Human. Seduction. At the beginning of the Resource Step, choose a challenge in play. Players may face that challenge during this Step.

name: Cordelia
effect: Human. Seduction. When another character Stunt-Doubles for Cordelia, he gains +3 Butt-Kicking for the remainder of the fight. Once per Resource Step, you may fatigue Cordelia to give a character at this location –1 Smarts and +2 Charm for the remainder of the turn.

name: Creep Factor
effect: The resolving talent for this fight is now Weirdness.

name: Cross-Referencing
effect: Assign to a character with the Computer Trait. If this character defeats a challenge requiring Computer, you gain 1 extra Destiny Point.

name: Crushing Blow
effect: If your character’s Butt-Kicking is at least twice that of your opponent’s character and you both have at least 1 card in a talent stack, both players must pass for the remainder of the Fight/Battle stage.

name: Day of Ascension
effect: When this event is played, at the beginning of the next Conflict Step, all characters in play are placed in Sunnydale Park. A player cannot pass in that Conflict Step as long as 1 of his characters can start a fight.

name: Dead Man's Party
effect: Assign to 1630 Revello Drive (Summers’ House). All Heroes here gain +1 Butt-Kicking while not facing a challenge.

name: Demon Hunting
effect: This character can move to any location with a Demon as if it were an adjacent location.

name: Demon in Sheep's Clothing
effect: Discard 2 cards from your hand to choose one of your Demons in play. For the remainder of the turn, that Demon gains a Trait of your choice and a +2 Butt-Kicking that cannot be used to meet talent requirements.

name: Demonology, Ph.D
effect: Assign to a character with the Demonology Trait. If this character defeats a challenge requiring Demonology, gain 1 extra Destiny Point.

name: Deputy Mayor Allan Finch
effect: Human. Deputy Mayor Allan Finch gains +1 to all his talents while at City Hall.

name: Deserted Cabin
effect: Players draw 2 extra cards duing the fight / Draw Stage at this location.

name: Disciplinary Council
effect: Until the end of the turn that this event is played, if a Slayer starts a fight with a Human, the attacking player loses 1 Destiny Point.

name: Discovery
effect: Discard the top card of your Resource Deck. If it’s an action card that can boost Smarts by 2, your opponent chooses for you to do 1 of the following: draw 2 cards; or look at your opponent’s hand, choose a card, and discard it.

name: Disturbing Features
effect: During the Fight-Challenge/Resolve stage, you may discard any or all cards in your Butt-Kicking talent stack. This character gains +1 Weirdness for each card discarded in this manner. You can use only 1 Disturbing Features per fight or challenge.

name: Don't Get Killed
effect: For the next 2 fights of this Conflict Step, if one of your characters loses a fight, you may lose 1 Destiny Point to keep that character from being discarded. Limit 1 per deck.

name: Done!
effect: Anyanka only. Use during the same step or stage that your opponent has played an action card. This card copies that card’s effect power. Ignore any talent requirements and any “(Character) Only” text. Send to the Crypt after use.

name: Doppelgangland
effect: When facing this challenge, you may place a character card into a talent stack to add +1 to a talent of your choice if your opponent has the same character in play. Trait Requirement: Spellcraft.

name: Dramatic Irony
effect: Discard the top card of your Resource Deck. If it’s an event, choose 1 of your characters in play. That character may attach an extra skill this turn and may move once during this step. This does not count as a move.

name: Drive Like Crazy
effect: Move one of your characters to an adjacent location. This does not count as a move. Send to the Crypt after use.

name: Dudes
effect: Human. Fatigue Dudes during the challenge/battle stage of a challenge they are facing to discard 1 card placed into a talent stack to boost Smarts.

name: Eliminati Swords
effect: Assign to a Vampire. While this Vampire is in a fight he started, he gains +1 Butt-Kicking and characters may not Stunt-Double for the attacked character. Only 1 Eliminati Swords may be attached to a character.

name: Eliminati Vamps
effect: Vampire. When you place Eliminati Vamps into play, you may search your Resource Deck for a copy of Eliminati Swords and attach it to this character.

name: Espresso Pump
effect: At the end of the Resource Step, every player chooses 1 of their opponents’ fatigued characters at this location if possible. The chosen characters refresh.

name: Eventful Combat
effect: For the remainder of the game, events may be placed into talent stacks to boost a talent of your choice by 1, just like items and skills.

name: Eye of Rat
effect: Fatigue this character and discard this item to give all other characters at the same location –1 Butt-Kicking for the remainder of the turn.

name: Fairy Tales are Real
effect: Hansel and Gretel must be used to defeat this challenge. Trait Requirement: Occult

name: Faith
effect: Human. Faith may start a fight with a Vampire, Demon or Monster at an adjacent location. If she does, place her at that location.

name: Faith
effect: Human. Faith may move to any location where an opponent’s Vampire, Demon or Monster is in play instead of to an adjacent location. Faith may start 1 fight during each Movement Step with a Vampire, Demon or Monster.

name: Faith
effect: Human. If Faith is refreshed here during an opponent’s Challenge/Choose stage, you can search your Resource Deck for a copy of Ambushed and immediately play it.

name: Faith
effect: Human. If Faith defeats a Main Character in a fight, gain 2 extra Destiny Points.

name: Faith
effect: Human. If Faith is refreshed at a location where an opponent defeated a challenge, that player cannot gain more than 3 Destiny Points for defeating that challenge.

name: Faith
effect: Human. Faith gains +1 Butt-Kicking while fighting a Vampire, Demon, or Monster.

name: Faith
effect: Human. Whenever Faith starts a fight with a Human, draw a card.

name: Faith "First Patrol"
effect: Human. If Faith is refreshed at a location where an opponent defeated a challenge, that player cannot gain more than 3 Destiny Points for defeating that challenge.

name: Faith "First Patrol"
effect: When Faith starts a fight, the opponent draws 2 less cards during the fight / Draw Stage.

name: Faith / Adam
effect: When Faith starts a fight, the opponent draws 2 less cards during the fight / Draw Stage.

name: Faith's Knife
effect: Character gains +1 Butt-Kicking and may not be attacked unless the other character has an equal or higher printed Butt-Kicking than the printed Butt-Kicking on this character.

name: Faith's Motel
effect: Once per turn, anything that would normally fatigue Faith does not fatigue her while she is here.

name: Fast Food
effect: If it is day when this event is played, it is now night. During the End Step of the turn this event is played, Vampires may start fights with Humans.

name: Flamma Vitae
effect: You must have Living Flame and Tome of Mediocrity attached to 1 or more characters facing this challenge to defeat it. Trait Requirement: Demonology, Spellcraft.

name: Formal Wear
effect: Character gains +1 Charm. If attached to Xander, Xander gains an additional +1 Charm and an additional +1 Charm during challenges. Only 1 Formal Wear can be attached to a character at a time.

name: Fountain Quad
effect: Characters do not fatigue while Stunt-Doubling here.

name: Freshman Year
effect: When this event is played, no player may face more than 1 challenge during the next Conflict Step.

name: Full-On Monster Fighting
effect: Discard the top card of your Resource Deck. If it’s an action that can boost Butt-Kicking by 2, one of your characters may immediately start a fight.

name: Garden Shed
effect: Characters need 1 less Destiny Point to ascend while here.

name: Gathering Votes
effect: Fatigue a character at the same location as one of your characters with the Seduction trait. Send to the Crypt after use.

name: Giles / Cordelia
effect: During the Resource Step, you may fatigue Giles to have another character gain one of Giles’ Traits until the end of the turn.

name: Gingerbread
effect: Characters with the Spellcraft Trait get a –1 to all of their talents while here. A player needs 2 characters with Spellcraft facing this challenge to defeat it.

name: Glove of Myhnegon
effect: Character gains +1 to all of his talents and gains the Demon Trait. If this item unattaches for any reason, send this character to the Crypt.

name: Gourmet Cuisine
effect: Assign to a Villain. During the Conflict Step, you may fatigue this character to discard a Companion at the same location with a lower Butt-Kicking than this character.

name: Group Support
effect: Choose a location and 1 of your characters at that location. All of your other characters there fatigue, and the chosen character gains +1 to a talent of your choice for each character you fatigued with this card.

name: Gwendolyn Post
effect: Human. Gwendolyn Post may face good and evil challenges. If Gwendolyn Post defeats a character in a fight, she may choose items placed into her talent stacks for that fight and attach them if possible.

name: Hair Flip
effect: The resolving talent for this fight is now Charm.

name: Hallway Scene-making
effect: Once per turn, if this character is at a school location, you may fatigue her during the Resource Step to give another character at this location a +1 to all of his talents for the remainder of the turn.

name: Hansel and Gretal
effect: Monster. Any supporting characters with Spellcraft that lose a fight are sent to the Crypt instead of the discard pile.

name: Haphazard Bomb
effect: At the end of the Conflict Step, you may send this character to the Crypt and pay 1 Destiny Point to send to the Crypt the location card beneath this character.

name: Hell
effect: Demons gain +1 to all of their talents while here.

name: Hell's Angel
effect: If this challenge is defeated, all players discard 1 character they control and shuffle 1 challenge they control back into their Challenge Deck.

name: Hellhound
effect: Demon. Hellhound can move to the location of a character that has Formal Wear attached as if it is an adjacent location. Hellhound gains +3 Butt-Kicking while in a fight with a Companion or Minion.

name: Hidden Allies
effect: Place a character into play at any location where you won a fight or challenge this turn.

name: Holy Hand Grenade
effect: Send this item to the Crypt during the Resource step to fatigue a Vampire supporting character at this location.

name: Homecoming
effect: If a character with Formal Wear is used to defeat this challenge, all characters here fatigue at the end of the Challenge/Resolve stage. Trait Requirement: Seduction.

name: Homecoming Queen
effect: Character gains the Seduction Trait.

name: I Love This Part
effect: Choose one of your opponent’s supporting characters at the same location as one of your refreshed Villians. During the next turn, the chosen character gets a –1 to all of her talents. If this would drop all of that character’s talents to 0 or below, discard that character.

name: I Quit
effect: This character is no longer participating in the fight or challenge. If she was your only participant, the Fight-Challenge/Battle Stage ends. The quitting character does not fatigue. Place her at an adjacent location.

name: I'm A Blood Sucking Fiend
effect: For the remainder of this fight, players cannot use the talent icon on the right hand side of action cards to boost a talent.

name: If at First You Don't Succeed
effect: If you fail to defeat this challenge, you may immediately face this challenge again after it resolves. Any characters fatigued from facing this challenge may face the challenge again. Send to the Crypt after use.

name: In the Past
effect: For the remainder of the game, players may not gain more than 4 Destiny Points for any challenges with the Pergamum Prophecy or Angel’s Curse expansion symbols.

name: Initiation
effect: For the remainder of the turn this Event is played, players may face 1 Challenge during the Resource Step.

name: Initiative Commandos
effect: Human. Initiative. If Initiative Commandos win a fight, you may discard an item attached to prevent them from fatiguing during the Fight/Resolve Stage of the fight.

name: Invulnerability
effect: Assign to a Villian. If this character is defeated in a fight while refreshed, discard this skill and fatigue this character. The character isn’t discarded or sent to the Crypt.

name: Jack O'Toole
effect: Undead. All of your other Undead characters in play gain +1 Butt-Kicking and Weirdness while Jack O’Toole is in play.

name: Jonathan Levenson
effect: Human. Wuss. All talent requirements on your opponents’ cards are increased by 1.

name: Kakistos
effect: Vampire. Kakistos does not fatigue at the end of the fight/Resolve Stage of the first fight that he starts each turn,

name: Kakistos / Maggie Walsh
effect: At the beginning of every turn, choose one of your opponent’s characters in play. For the remainder of the turn, when Kakistos starts a fight with that character, draw 2 cards and if he wins the fight you gain 1 extra Destiny Point.

name: Ken
effect: Demon. During the Resource Step, you may send Ken to the Crypt to place one of your opponents’ characters here at any location of your choice.

name: Kicking Demon A$$
effect: When resolving this fight, any action cards in talent stacks add another +1 to the talent that they are boosting.

name: Killer of the Dead
effect: If this character defeats a Vampire supporting character in a fight, the Vampire is sent to the Crypt.

name: Knife Practice
effect: During the Resource Step, fatigue this character to give another character at the same location +X Butt-Kicking for the remainder of the turn, where X is the attached character’s current Butt-Kicking.

name: Knowledge is Power
effect: For the remainder of the turn, all of your Companions and Minions do not fatigue when attaching skills. Limit 1 per deck.

name: Larry Blaisdell
effect: Human. While at a school location, Larry Blaisdell gains +1 Butt-Kicking and +1 Smarts, and once per turn may Stunt-Double for another character while fatigued.

name: Living Flame
effect: Discard Living Flame during the fight-Challenge/Battle Stage to change a card in a talent stack that is boosting Weirdness to the talent of your choice. Move the changed card into the correct talent stack.

name: Locker Search
effect: When this event is played, all players show their hands to their opponents and discards all items in their hands.

name: Love Tattoo
effect: During the fight-challenge/Resolve stage, you may discard any or all cards in your Butt-Kicking talent stack. This character gains +1 Charm for each card discarded in this manner. Only 1 Love Tattoo can be used per fight or challenge. This item cannot be swapped.

name: Lover's Return
effect: If Witch Pez Dispenser is attached to a character that defeats this challenge, she may choose 1 card in her talent stacks to be placed on top of her Resource Deck. Trait Requirement: Spellcraft

name: Lunch Lady
effect: Human. If Lunch Lady is at a school location any Human supporting characters at the same location cannot refresh. Once per turn a fatigued character may start a fight with Lunch Lady.

name: Lunch Special
effect: If Lunch Lady is at this location, add her matching talents to the talent goals, and this challenge is worth 1 extra Destiny Point.

name: Lust For Her Death
effect: Kakistos only. Place the character that was chosen by Kakistos’ essence card power at the beginning of this turn at Kakistos’ location.

name: Lyle & Candy Gorch
effect: Vampire. Fatigue Lyle & Candy Gorch during the Movement Step to have them start a fight with another character at the same location.

name: Maggie Walsh
effect: Human. Initiative. Science. Maggie Walsh gains +1 Weirdness and +1 Smarts while facing challenges that require the Occult Trait.

name: Major Wiggins
effect: Assign to one of your opponent’s characters without fatiguing him. This character cannot refresh. A player may send this card to the Crypt by fatiguing X Characters at this location. X equals this character’s level. Limit 1 per deck.

name: Make It A Double
effect: Choose one of your characters in play. For the remainder of the turn, the Destiny Requirement for ascending that character is replaced by 2 Destiny Points. Limit 1 per deck.

name: Manic-Depressive Chick
effect: All players choose 1 of their supporting characters in play. The chosen characters fatigue.

name: Maps and Stuff
effect: Assign to a character with the Computer Trait. During the Movement Step, anything that would normally affect this character because it moved does not affect this character.

name: Mask of Ovu Mobani
effect: Assign to one of your characters that has a copy of herself in your discard pile. Character gains +1 to all of her talents. If this item unattaches for any reason, this character gets discarded.

name: Mayor Richard Wilkins III
effect: Human. Demonology. At the end of the Draw Step, your opponents discard the top card of their Resource Decks for each card they drew during this Step.

name: Mayor Richard Wilkins III
effect: Demon. Demonology. Mayor Richard Wilkins III needs Box of Gavrok attached to ascend to this level. At the beginning of each turn, your opponents discard the top 5 cards of their Resource Decks.

name: Mayor Richard Wilkins III
effect: Human. Demonology. At the beginning of the Prologue Step if Mayor Richard Wilkins III is refreshed, all of your opponents discard the top 2 cards of their Resource Decks.

name: Mobile Tracking System
effect: Fatigue this character and another 1 of your characters during the Conflict Step. The chosen character is placed at an adjacent location and may immediately start a fight. This does not count as a move. Vampires cannot use this item during the day.

name: Modern Day Vampire
effect: Mr. Trick only. For the remainder of the turn, whenever you attach an item to Mr. Trick from your hand, draw a card. Mr. Trick does not fatigue during the Fight / Resolve stage of the first fight he starts this turn. Send to the Crypt after use.

name: Morality Lecture
effect: Choose one of your characters in play. That character becomes a Hero for the remainder of the turn.

name: Mr. Trick
effect: Vampire. Computer. When Mr. Trick starts a fight with a Human, if you control another Minion at the same location, add that Minion’s total Butt-Kicking to Mr. Trick Butt-Kicking for the remainder of the fight.

name: Mr. Trick
effect: Vampire. Computer. If Mr. Trick is defeated in a fight, you may discard one of your other Vampires here instead.

name: Mr. Trick
effect: Vampire. Fatigue a Vampire you control here to give Mr. Trick +1 Butt-Kicking for the remainder of the turn.

name: Mr. Trick / Harmony
effect: During the Resource Step, if Mr. Trick is refreshed, you may add Mr. Trick’s talents to a challenge’s talent goals if the challenge is at the same or adjacent location as Mr. Trick. Afterward, fatigue Mr. Trick.

name: Neat Freak
effect: Discard all of your opponents’ cards that are attached to your characters. Send to the Crypt after use.

name: Necronomenclature
effect: Assign to a character with the Occult Trait. If this character defeats a Challenge requiring Occult, gain 1 extra Destiny Point.

name: Off My Game
effect: Choose a character that is level 2 or higher. That character now uses his underlying level 1 character card for the remainder of the turn, and ignores the effect powers, Traits, and talents of his higher levels.

name: Oh Fff…
effect: If both players participating in this challenge have at least 1 card in a talent stack, both players must choose 1 card from their own talent stack, and discard it.

name: One Man Army
effect: Assign to a school location or Sunnydale Park. If Xander is your main character and is facing this challenge alone, this challenge is worth 3 extra Destiny Points.

name: Out of Options
effect: For the remainder of the game, if a player has 30 or more cards in his Crypt, not counting locations or challenges, that player immediately loses the game.

name: Oz
effect: Werewolf. If it is day at the beginning of the Refresh Step, send Oz’s level 3 to the Crypt. Any other attached cards remain attached.

name: Oz
effect: Human. Once per turn during the Prologue Step, you may search your Resource Deck for an Oz level 2 and place it into your hand.

name: Oz
effect: Human. If Oz defeats a challenge and your opponent has at least 1 Hero or Villian here, Oz does not fatigue during the Challenge/Resolve Stage.

name: Oz / Buffy Bizarro Land
effect: If Oz is a Werewolf, you do not have to send his current level to the Crypt during the Refresh Step of a day turn.

name: Oz Watch
effect: Oz only. For the remainder of the turn, when Oz ascends, gain 1 Destiny Point. Limit 1 per deck.

name: Pat
effect: Undead. All talent requirements on your opponent’s cards are increased by 1.

name: Percy West
effect: Human. While at a school location, Percy West gains +1 Smarts and may attach 1 additional item.

name: Pete
effect: Human. When fighting a Human, Pete does not fatigue during the Fight/Resolve Stage. All characters that fight Pete that aren’t Human gain a +1 to all of their talents during the fight.

name: Please, Not in the Face
effect: Choose a character with the Wuss trait in play. Until the end of the turn, the chosen character cannot start a fight, and other characters cannot start a fight with him.

name: Power of the Wish
effect: If Anyanka is used to defeat this challenge, the player may either choose to gain 2 extra Destiny Points or search his Resource Deck for Symbol of Anyanka and attach it to Anyanka.

name: Preparing for Ascension
effect: Mayor Richard Wilkins III only. If your opponent has recycled his Resource Deck this turn, you may search your Resource Deck for any item or skill, show it to your opponent, and place it into your hand. A player may only play 1 Preparing for Ascension per turn.

name: Price of True Evil
effect: Faith must face this challenge alone. If this challenge is defeated, you may search your Resource Deck for Faith’s next level and ascend her, ignoring Destiny Requirements.

name: Prom
effect: Discard the top card of your Resource Deck. If it’s an action card that can boost Charm by 2, choose a location in play. For the remainder of the turn, all of your characters there gain the text, “Fatigue this character to fatigue any supporting character here.”

name: Quality Rage
effect: If this skill is attached to your Main Character, you may discard this skill whenever your opponent tries to unattach an item from a Villian or Minion. The item stays attached and cannot be swapped for the remainder of the turn.

name: Raising the Stakes
effect: Your main character may ascend as many times as you want this turn, ignoring any Destiny Requirements. At the end of the turn, send to the Crypt the attached levels that your Main Character ascended this turn, even if they are in the Discard pile.

name: Return of The First
effect: Assign to a subterranean location. The Harbingers must be used to defeat this challenge.

name: Riley Finn
effect: Human. Initiative. Riley gains +1 Charm while at the same location as Buffy.

name: Ripper Giles
effect: Human. Occult. Once per turn fatigue Giles during the Resource Step to have Giles start a fight.

name: Rivalry
effect: All players choose up to 2 of their supporting Heroes or Villians in play. All other supporting Heroes and Villians discard all attached items, and are then discarded. Each player loses 2 Destiny Points per character he discards.

name: Rupert Giles
effect: Human. Demonology. Occult. Spellcraft. Once during the Resource Step, you may fatigue Giles and discard an item from your hand to discard an item attached to another character at the same location.

name: Rupert Giles
effect: Human. Demonology. You may fatigue Giles during the Resource Step to give a character at an adjacent location a +1 to a talent of your choice until the end of the turn.

name: Rupert Giles
effect: Human. Demonology. Once per turn you may fatigue Giles during the Prologue Step. If you do, no player may draw cards from card effects for the remainder of the turn.

name: Scoring Well
effect: You may fatigue this character and another character at the same location during the Challenge/Choose stage. The chosen character is placed at the challenge’s location to participate in the challenge even though she is fatigued.

name: Scott Hope
effect: Human. While at the same location as Buffy, Scott gains +1 Charm. Scott may Stunt-Double for Buffy without fatiguing.

name: Slayer Kryptonite
effect: Assign to your or your opponent’s Slayer. Character gains –2 Butt-Kicking and an additional –1 if the Tento di Cruciamentum challenge is in play.

name: Slayer's Fortitude
effect: Assign to a Slayer. Whenever your opponent is facing a challenge at this character’s location, you may draw 2 additional cards during the Challenge/Draw Step.

name: Slayer's Handiwork
effect: Look at the top 5 cards of your opponent’s Resource Deck. Discard all Vampires in those 5 cards, and place the remaining cards on top of your opponent’s Resource Deck in any oder.

name: Slayer's Lust
effect: Faith only. Draw a card. Immediately set aside Slayer’s Lust into a talent stack to boost either Butt-Kicking by 2 or Charm by 1.

name: Slayer's Training
effect: Assign to a Slayer. During any step, you may discard this skill. If you do, this character’s level is +1 for the remainder of the turn.

name: Slayerfest
effect: Assign to an outdoor location. If a Slayer is defeated in a fight while this challenge is in play, the winner of the fight gains 1 extra Destiny Point.

name: Snow
effect: If this event is played during the day, Vampires can move like Humans this turn. No fights or challenges can be started until the next End Step of a night turn.

name: Spells, Cursies and Whammies
effect: During the Resource Step, fatigue this character to give another character at the same location +X Weirdness for the remainder of the turn, where X is the attached character’s current Weirdness.

name: Spike
effect: Vampire. During the Resource Step, you may fatigue Spike and discard a skill attached to him. Search your Resource Deck for up to 2 copies of that skill, show them to your opponent, and place them into your hand.

name: Sporting Goods Store
effect: Once per turn per player, when a character attaches an item here, that character’s controller may draw a card.

name: Spring Madness
effect: Assign to April Fools Dress Shop or a school location.

name: Start the Juicer
effect: The Master must be used to defeat this challenge. If defeated, for the remainder of the game, Humans that lose a fight to a Vampire are sent to the Crypt. The first time this happens each turn, the winner gains 1 extra Destiny Point.

name: Sunnydale Arms
effect: During the Movement Step, a player may move any challenge she controls here to any adjacent location if she has no challenge there.

name: Symbol of Anyanka
effect: Must be assigned to Anya or Anyanka. You may discard Symbol of Anyanka during the Resource Step to search your Resource Deck for an Episode Part 1 and place it in your hand. This item cannot be swapped.

name: Telekinesis
effect: Assign to a character with Spellcraft. Once per turn during the Resource Step, you may reassign items on this character and one other character you control at the same location.

name: Telepathic Block
effect: If ths character is refreshed, you don’t have to show your opponent any cards in your hand because of card effects.

name: Tento di Cruciamentum
effect: Assign to Sunnydale Arms. If Buffy defeats this challenge alone and has Slayer Kryptonite attached, this challenge is worth 3 extra Destiny Points.

name: Testosterone
effect: The resolving talent for this fight is now Butt-Kicking.

name: The Big Night
effect: Disturbing Features must be attached to a character facing this challenge to defeat it. If Tucker Wells is used to defeat this challenge, he does not discard his hand during this Challenge/Discard stage.

name: The Dream
effect: When this event is played, all players gain 1 Destiny Point in a clockwise manner starting with the player of this card.

name: The First
effect: Pure Evil. During the Conflict Step, you may fatigue The First and choose one of your opponents’ refreshed characters at the same location. During that opponent’s next watch in this step, that character must start a fight if possible.

name: The Harbingers
effect: Demon. The Harbingers gain +2 Weirdness while at a subterranean location.

name: The Help of the Merry Men
effect: If you control at least 1 Companion or Minion at each of your 4 locations, all of your Companions and Minions gain +2 Butt-Kicking for the remainder of the turn.

name: The Master
effect: Vampire. Demonology. Spellcraft. All Vampires you control gain +1 Butt-Kicking. You need to control Sunnydale Park for 1 less turn to win a Park Victory.

name: The Master
effect: Vampire. Demonology. Spellcraft. During the Resource Step, you may discard a refreshed Minion Vampire you control at the same location as The Master to make your opponent discard a card from her hand.

name: The Master / Anyanka
effect:
Whenever an opponent starts a fight or challenge, that player discards a card, if possible.
/
Once during each Prologue Step, you may discard an action card that has a Weirdness icon to draw 2 cards.

name: The Mayor / Kathy
effect: If your opponent recycles her discard pile during the Draw Step, you may fatigue The Mayor during the Resource Step or End Step of that turn to change day to night or night to day.

name: Three-some
effect: For the remainder of this step, if Vamp Willow and Vamp Xander are refreshed and at the same location, they may start fights together. For these fights, they add their talents together and are considered to be 1 character.

name: Through the Demon Portal
effect: Assign to Hell. If Ken is used to defeat this challenge, this challenge is worth 1 extra Destiny Point. Trait Requirement: Demon

name: Tiny Victory
effect: Players cannot lose Destiny Points during the resolution of this challenge. The attacking player cannot gain any more Destiny Points for defeating the challenge than what is printed on it.

name: Tome of Mediocrity
effect: This character now has the Spellcraft Trait. Character gains +1 to all of his talents during the night. If this item becomes unattached from this character for any reason, this character is sent to the Crypt.

name: Trade Talks
effect: During the Conflict Step, this character may take a legally attachable item from any character here with a lower Butt-Kicking and attach it. Afterward, fatigue the attaching character.

name: Tranquilized
effect: If you have a character with Tranquilizer Gun attached, fatigue a Companion or Minion in play.

name: Tranquilizer Gun
effect: Fatigue this character and this item during the Conflict Step to fatigue a supporting character at this location. This item cannot refresh during the next Refresh Step.

name: Tucker Wells
effect: Human. Once during the Resource Step, you may search your discard pile or Resource Deck for a Hellhound, show it to your opponent, and place it into your hand.

name: Tutoring
effect: During the Resource Step, fatigue this character to give another character at the same location +X Smarts for the remainder of the turn, where X is this attached character’s current Smarts.

name: UC Sunnydale Commons
effect: Characters may move between this location and any college location as if they were adjacent locations.

name: Unknown Outcome
effect: Both players in this fight discard their hands and draw 5 cards.

name: Untrustworthy
effect: Until the end of the turn, every player may only have 1 Hero or Villain face a challenge at a time.

name: Vamp Willow
effect: Vampire. If Vampire Embrace is used in a fight for its effect, and Vamp Willow wins, gain 1 Extra Destiny Point.

name: Vamp Willow
effect: Vampire. When Vamp Willow starts a fight, you may search your Resource Deck for a copy of Vampire Embrace and place it into your hand.

name: Vamp Willow / Vamp Xander
effect:
At the beginning of the Resource Step, you may shuffle all copies of Vampire Embrace in your discard pile back into your Resource Deck.
/
If Vamp Willow is in play, Vamp Xander gains +1 to all of his talents. If Vamp Willow and Vamp Xander face a challenge together, lower the talent goal of that challenge by 2, if possible.

name: Vamp Xander
effect: Vampire. You may fatigue Vamp Xander during the Resource Step to give a Vampire +2 to a talent of your choice for the rest of the turn.

name: Vampire Embrace
effect: Attach to your opponent’s Human Minion or Human Companion. If he loses this fight to a Vampire, he stays in play and becomes your Vampire instead of a Human until he leaves play or the game ends. Otherwise, discard this card.

name: Verbal Non-Verbal
effect: This character ignores Smarts talent requirements for attaching skills and items.

name: Want, Take, Have
effect: Discard the top card of your Resource Deck. If it’s an item, you may search your Resource Deck for up to 2 copies of that item, show them to your opponents, and place them into your hand.

name: Warding
effect: Assign to a Hero. You may discard this skill and fatigue this character during the Movement Step. Demons and Vampires cannot move to this location for the remainder of the turn.

name: Watching Playtime
effect: Vamp Xander only. For the remainder of this step, whenever a fight or challenge starts at Vamp Xander’s location and he is not involved, Vamp Xander gains +1 to all his talents until the end of this step.

name: Wesley Wyndam-Pryce
effect: Human. Occult. Wuss. Fatigue a Wuss you control during the Resource Step to choose a card in your discard pile and shuffle it back into your Resource Deck.

name: Who Do You Work For
effect: Vamp Willow only. Assign to your opponent’s Vampire supporting character. If he loses this fight, he stays in play under your control until he leaves play or the game ends. Otherwise, discard this card.

name: Willow
effect: Human. Spellcraft. Computer. All your characters with Spellcraft at adjacent locations gain +1 Smarts and +1 Weirdness.

name: Willow
effect: Human. Spellcraft. Computer. You may fatigue Willow during the Resource Step to give all characters at adjacent locations +1 Smarts for the remainder of the turn.

name: Willow / Tara
effect: Whenever Willow defeats a challenge with a Computer or Spellcraft Trait Requirement, Willow does not fatigue.

name: Willow Rosenberg
effect: Human. Computer. You may fatigue Willow during the Resource Step to give a character at an adjacent location +1 Smarts until the end of the turn.

name: Wish Granted
effect: If Cordelia is used to defeat this challenge, she does not fatigue during the Challenge/Resolve Stage, and you may place the top challenge of your Challenge Deck into play after you send this challenge to the Crypt.

name: Wish: The Weirding
effect: Attach this card to one of your opponent’s challenges. While this card is attached, the printed Butt-Kicking on the challenge is now Weirdness, the printed Weirdness is now Smarts, the printed Smarts in now Charm, and the printed Charm is now Butt-Kicking. Each player may only have 1 Wish: The Weirding in play.

name: Witch Pez Dispenser
effect: This character is immune to any effects from character cards with the Seduction Trait.

name: Xander
effect: Human. At the beginning of every turn, choose one of your characters at Xander’s location. Xander gains that character’s Traits until the end of the turn, excluding the first printed Trait.

name: Xander
effect: Human. Whenever Xander swaps an item to another one of your characters, you may ignore the talent requirement of the item.

name: Xander / Anya
effect: Your Episode Part 2 cards cannot be cancelled.

name: Xander Harris
effect: Human. If Xander is defeated in a fight, the winner does not gain any Destiny Points.

name: Xander the Zeppo
effect: Human. Occult. Xander may move during the Movement Step even if he is fatigued. Xander does not fatigue during the resolution of a challenge if an opponent controls a Vampire at the same location.

name: Young at Heart
effect: For the remainder of the turn this Event is played, characters do not fatigue during the Challenge/Resolve Stage.

name: Young, Fast and Hot-Blooded
effect: Assign to a town location. If Rupert Giles and Joyce Summers are the only characters defeating this challenge, the challenge is worth 2 extra Destiny Points.

name: Zachary Kralik
effect: Vampire. During a fight, Zachary Kralik may use the Charm talents on the top half of action cards to boost Butt-Kicking.

name: “Bad Girls” Part 1
effect:
Effect:  Once each turn during the Conflict Step, one of your Slayers can attack while fatigued.
Target:  Have 2 Slayers in play and a Slayer defeats a Human in a fight.

name: “Bad Girls” Part 2
effect:
Result:  If your slayer defeats a supporting character, place that character in the Crypt.
Cancel:  You do not have 2 Slayers at the same location during the End Step.

name: “Band Candy” Part 1
effect:
Effect:  No Heroes or Villians can be played by a player who already has 3 or more Heroes or Villians in play.
Target:  2 of your opponent’s characters have Candy Bars attached.

name: “Band Candy” Part 2
effect:
Result:  When this card enters play, all characters with Candy Bars attached are placed in Sunnydale Park.  They cannot move or start a fight.
Cancel:  A character with Candy Bars attached is not in Sunnydale Park.

name: “Graduation Day” Part 1
effect:
Effect:  Characters may move to the Fountain Quad from any location.
Target:  A total of 4 Heroes and/or Villians controlled by any players are at the Fountain Quad, and Mayor Richard Wilkers III is in play.

name: “Graduation Day” Part 2
effect:
Result:  When facing Ascension of Olivikan or Commencement Ceremonies during the Challenge/Choose Step, choose a  talent.  Ignore this talent for this challenge.
Cancel:  Mayor Richard Wilkens III leaves play.

name: “Lover's Walk” Part 1
effect:
Effect:  Willow and Xander gain +1 Charm.
Target:  Willow and Xander, but no other characters, defeat a challenge together that has a Charm talent goal.

name: “Lover's Walk” Part 2
effect: Result:  When this card enters play, search your Resource Deck for Xander’s and/or Willow’s next level and ascend them, ignoring the Destiny Requirements.

name: “The Wish” Part 1
effect:
Effect:  All characters gain +1 charm while at a School location.
Target:  Anyanka has 4 Charm during the Prologue Step and the Symbol of Anyanka is attached.

name: “The Wish” Part 2
effect:
Result:  Heroes and Companions cannot move during the night.
Cancel:  Symbol of Anyanka is not in play.

name: “The Zeppo” Part 1
effect:
Effect:  Xander’s printed talents are doubled when facing a challenge alone.
Target:  Xander defeats a challenge alone.

name: “The Zeppo” Part 2
effect:
Result:  Your Xander refreshes at the end of every Resource and Conflict Step.
Cancel:  Your Xander did not move during the Movement Step.
